intro: Carapichea necopinata, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or the golden starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers that resemble stars. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are similar in appearance to starfruits but are less commonly consumed. Its foliage is typically dark green and glossy, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely on the stems. Carapichea necopinata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
